misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of MD5 as a cryptographic hash function is broken and should not be used for security-sensitive applications. MD5 has been shown to be vulnerable to collisions, which can lead to impersonation and other attacks.
recommendation: Use a stronger cryptographic hash function such as SHA-256, SHA-384, or SHA-512 instead of MD5.
